sections.purpose: To measure and monitor temperature accurately in experimental and storage settings.
sections.scope: Applicable to temperature recording in pharmacology laboratories.
procedure: Switch ON the digital thermometer and verify the display is functioning.
Select the appropriate measurement mode (air, surface, or probe) if applicable.
Place the sensor or probe at the desired location.
Allow sufficient time for the reading to stabilize.
Record the temperature and location in the log sheet.
Switch OFF the thermometer after use to conserve battery.
Store the instrument and probes in a clean, dry place.
precautions: Do not expose the thermometer to excessive heat or moisture.
Handle probes carefully to avoid cable damage.
Calibrate periodically against a reference thermometer.
Replace batteries when low-battery indicator appears.
Disinfect probes after contact with biological materials.
